text:
Rob Kardashian 'furious' with Blac Chyna after theme park fight and is 'threatening to take her to court'

"If Rob wants a custody fight, he will have one, and he will regret it," Chyna's lawyer Lisa Bloom said in response to the reports

Rob Kardashian is said to be 'furious' with Blac Chyna after the mother of his child was filmed lashing out at a woman.

‌



Over the weekend, Chyna launched her stroller at a woman who 'touched' daughter Dream while they enjoyed a day out at a Six Flags theme park in California.

‌



Following the incident, a source told E! News: "Rob is furious with Chyna for putting Dream in danger.

‌



"He plans to file papers to try and get more custody of Dream and to reduce Chyna's child support.

"He hopes the judge will see that he wants what's best for Dream and that he is putting her safety and best interest before anything else."

They added: "Rob feels she needs to have a chaperone when Dream is in her custody to ensure that she is safe."

‌



View 6 Images Rob is also reportedly threatening to take her to court (Image: WENN.com)

View 6 Images Chyna's statement

‌



View 6 Images Chyna took King and Dream to Six Flags (Image: Instagram)

According to TMZ, Rob also wants 'clear rules' set about what his ex 'can and can't do when the child is present'.

What's more, he's also said to be concerned about Dream being introduced to Chyna's boyfriends too soon, and is apparently seeking an order to prevent their daughter from meeting any of their partners before the six month mark.

‌



Responding to the reports, Chyna's lawyer Lisa Bloom said: "Chyna has the right every mother has to defend her own children from strangers trying to touch them.

"If Rob wants a custody fight, he will have one, and he will regret it. We already beat his sister Kylie in the meritless case she filed against Chyna."

6 View 6 Images The reality TV star is said to be furious (Image: FameFlynet ) 6 View 6 Images Chyna was captured on camera throwing the stroller (Image: TWITTER / @JordansMainAcc)

‌



After footage of the aftermath was posted online, 29-year-old Chyna took to Instagram to issue a statement.

She wrote: "Being famous is hard enough dealing with scrutiny but when someone feels comfortable to come and touch your child it's a whole other story.

‌



View 6 Images Chyna's new 18 year old boyfriend (Image: Instagram/ybnalmightyjay)

"I do not condone violence nor am I a violent person but shout out to all the amazing mothers out there that will protect their children at all cost.

"Love, King and Dreams Mommy"

Article continues below

Chyna had been spotted by witnesses taking off her pink coat and picking up a plastic stroller in the shape of a bright pink car, dragging it along the ground by its long handle then throwing it at a group of people nearby.
